title: Website
text:
Creat a new website project
quarto create-project your-web-site-dir --type website
Add _site/ to .gitignore if necessary.
Preview the website with
cd your-web-site-dir
quarto preview
The preview web server is slow. Consider using Node.js
npx http-server -p 3000 -o _site -a 127.0.0.1
Publish to GitHub Pages, see GitHut Pages for details.
Create gh-pages branch (only necessary the first time)
git checkout --orphan gh-pages
git reset --hard # make sure you've committed changes before running this!
git commit --allow-empty -m "Initialising gh-pages branch"
git push origin gh-pages
Check out the publishing branch (not on the gh-pages branch), and
quarto publish gh-pages
See Quarto for more details.

title: MyQuartoDoc
text: This is a Quarto website to collect commonly used features to write technical report.

title: CSS
text:
Copy

style.css
theme.scss

from Quarto to project directory, and add the following to _quarto.yml.
format:
  html:
    theme:
      light: [cosmo, theme.scss]
    css: styles.css

title: CSS
text:
Copy

style.css
theme.scss

from Quarto to project directory, and add the following to _quarto.yml.
format:
  html:
    theme:
      light: [cosmo, theme.scss]
    css: styles.css

title: Cross reference
text:
Create an anchor ANCHOR-1 with
[ANCHOR-1]{#anchor-1}

title: Cross reference
text:
Create an anchor ANCHOR-1 with
[ANCHOR-1]{#anchor-1}

title: Cross reference
text:
Link
Create link to

anchor: Link to Anchor-1
URL https://www.google.com, or
URL Google,
email fake@example.com,
local file styles, or
local file file:styles.css,
section Anchor,
section in another qmd file, Figure basic,
figure in another qmd file, Go to Julia Logo.

* anchor: [Link to Anchor-1](#anchor-1)
* URL <https://www.google.com>{target="_blank"}, or
* URL [Google](https://www.google.com){target="_blank"},
* email <fake@example.com>,
* local file [styles](styles.css), or
* local file <file:styles.css>,
* section [Anchor](#anchor),
* section in another `qmd` file, [Figure basic](figure.qmd#figure-basic),
* figure in another `qmd` file, [Go to Julia Logo](figure.qmd#fig-julia_logo_local).
Open link in a new browser tab with {target="_blank"}.
[Quarto Web](https://github.com/quarto-dev/quarto-web/tree/main){target="_blank"}
Quarto Web

title: Figure
text:
Configuration

Listing 1: Move figure caption to the top in _quarto.yml
format:
  html:
    fig-cap-location: top

title: Figure
text:
Cross reference
This section is purposely placed at the end, in order to see the effect of cross reference to figures.
[Go to Julia Logo](#fig-julia_logo_local) or @fig-julia_logo_local

title: Table
text:
Size and position

Use CSS grid to adjust the width and position the table.
The tbl-colwidths option adds up to 12.

Use : to align each column.

:::{.grid}
:::{.g-col-2}
:::
:::{.g-col-8}
| Case | Well | Production | Formation | Year |
|:-----|:-----|-----------:|:---------:|-----:|
| JJ-1 | H-1  | 20         |  WFMPA    | 5    |
| JJ-1 | H-2  | 22         |  WFMPA    | 5    |
| JJ-1 | H-3  | 28         |  WFMPB    | 5    |
: Well production {#tbl-well_1 tbl-colwidths="[1,1,1,2,1]"}
:::
:::{.g-col-2}
:::
:::
